intro: Capsella provincialis, commonly known as the provincial morning glory, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Capsella provincialis is characterized by its slender stems and small, elongated leaves.
